1436685849291284481.text:
We remember the victims & the heroes. 

It’s 20 years on, and we will #NeverForget

1436685848016310281.text: Today we also mark the end of our longest military conflict. We are so grateful for all of the brave members of our community who served in Iraq & Afghanistan in the 20 years following the 9/11 attacks, and we remember all the sacrifices that have been made and the lives lost.

1436685845856141312.text: These selfless Americans face asthma, cancer, and many other difficult medical challenges to this day.  We must ease the burden for these brave individuals who risked their lives for their neighbors on after 9/11.

1436685844413390849.text: We remember all of the heroic first responders who risked or gave their lives to help their fellow citizens. Many of them have lasting physical and emotional scars from their bravery.

1436685842483920896.text: Our thoughts are with their families today as we marvel at the beautiful ways they honor the memories of those they loved.  We, too, honor them.

1436685841166909443.text: We mourn the nearly 3,000 lives cut short that day, thinking about the Portraits of Grief we read in the weeks and months after, where we were moved by the magnitude of the combined contributions the victims made to their families and to our nation during their lifetimes.

1436685838960795649.text: Twenty years ago today, our nation endured one of the greatest national tragedies in our history. The attacks of 9/11 forever changed us. All of us. https://t.co/QaACgRtLij
